Subject: Philosophy
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - The nature and methods of philosophy
Statement: Key terms associated with philosophical reasoning such as argument, premise, assumption, conclusion, proposition, claim, assertion, standard form, deduction, induction, cogency, validity, soundness, contradiction, fallacy, syllogism, analogy, example, counterexample, counterargument, definition, thought experiment

Statement: The distinctive nature of philosophical thinking.

Subject: Philosophy
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - The good life and the individual
Statement: Concepts used in discussion of the good life as relevant to the set texts, such as altruism, authenticity blame, creativity, duty, egoism, freedom, happiness, hedonism, human nature, meaningfulness, morality, pain, pleasure, praise, self-restraint, teleology, values, virtue and wisdom

Subject: Philosophy

Statement: Viewpoints and arguments proposed in the set texts as relevant to these general questions:

Subject: Philosophy
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - The good life and the individual
Statement: What role do pleasure and self-discipline play in a good life?

Subject: Philosophy
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - The good life and the individual

Subject: Philosophy
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - The good life and the individual

Subject: Philosophy
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - The good life and the individual
